answers.answer: Hi, low GFR is associated with CKD which in your case could be due to complication of diabetes or immunosuppressant drugs which were administered during transplant. The progress of disease can be delayed by restricting sodium, potassium, protein in diet and keeping sugar levels under control.For more information visithttp://www.kidney.org/kidneydisease/ckd/knowGFR.cfmhttp://www.emedicinehealth.com/chronic_kidney_disease/article_em.htm

question: i am a 52 year old male diabetic and high blood pressure and i just had lab work the Glom filt rate came back as 58 the creatinine serum  is 1.29 bun level 19, what concerns should i have . Do i have CKD?  Also i had a liver transplant 5 year ago. type ii diabetics.
title: glom filt rate
